Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Crummy \Crum"my\ (kr[u^]m"m[y^]), a. 1. Full of crumb or crumbs. [1913 Webster]
2. Soft, as the crumb of bread is; not crusty. [1913 Webster]
3. of very poor quality. [informal]
Syn: bum, cheap, cheesy, chintzy, crummy, punk, sleazy, tinny. [WordNet 1.5]
crummy adj : of very poor quality [syn: {bum}, {cheap}, {cheesy}, {chintzy}, {punk}, {sleazy}, {tinny}] [also: {crummiest}, {crummier}]
